meanings.sent1: The workers were manhandling the heavy boxes onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: The security guard was accused of manhandling the shoplifter.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was manhandling the toy car, pretending it was a monster truck.
meanings.sent4: The storm was manhandling the trees, bending them with its powerful winds.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler was manhandling his opponent, showing his strength and skill.

meanings.sent1: The bully was manhandling the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The abusive boss was known for manhandling his employees.
meanings.sent3: The chef was manhandling the dough, trying to get it just right for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The waves were manhandling the boat, rocking it back and forth violently.
meanings.sent5: The coach was manhandling the players, pushing them to their limits in training.

meanings.definition: To move or handle with force or violence.
meanings.sent1: The protesters were manhandling the barricades, trying to break through.
meanings.sent2: The criminals were caught manhandling the stolen goods in the alley.
meanings.sent3: The magician was manhandling the deck of cards, performing a mesmerizing trick.
meanings.sent4: The tornado was manhandling everything in its path, destroying buildings and trees.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was manhandling the engine, trying to fix the car before the race.
